channel.title: Array Error
channel.description:
Hey. I'm getting this array error.
How can I fix this?
[code=java]java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1 at Class36.methodCustomAnimations(Class36.java:63) at Animation.unpackConfig(Animation.java:2124) at Client.startUp(Client.java:7446) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:35) at Client.run(Client.java:4688) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)[/code]

item.title: Array Error
item.dc:creator: @llcoolchris llcoolchris
item.description:
@llcoolchris wrote:

Skyro:

What do I need to do, it is in all PI clients. It is because the array is to small, and needs to be bigger but idk how to do that.

All pi clients? trying using the opposite if you are using jdk use jre. might be your issue and try updating both. My windows 7 computer has this same issues with 608’s+ i have to use jdk for compiles and jre’s for runs.

EDIT: goes for anyone having compiler issues

small tut:

if this is your run.bat

@echo off title Acquittal java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/RuneTopListV2.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause

click my computer > program files > java > UR JDK VERSION > BIN

delete

java from the run.bat like so

@echo off title Acquittal -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/RuneTopListV2.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause

add your class path like so

[code]

@echo off
title Acquittal
C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/RuneTopListV2.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
pause[/code]

then quote it
like so

@echo off title Acquittal "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/RuneTopListV2.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause

wala your server is runs.

what this does?

It tells the server where to find java.exe, kinda like someone saying to a mouse cheese, but the mouse wont know where until you say cheese, under my bed.

(best thing i could think of) haha

also watch the run.bats

if it has something like the word “repeat” don’t click on it!

also some have javac instead of java or also javaw

if it has javac use jdk

if it has javaw use jre

that one word always comes after /bin

C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin[i]java[/i].exe

C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk7\bin[i]javac[/i].exe

C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin[i]javaw[/i].exe

Read full topic

item.title: Array Error
item.dc:creator: @llcoolchris llcoolchris
item.description:
@llcoolchris wrote:

Attaching a snippet of code where the exception is occurring would make it easier to identify however,

ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException occurs when the index you reference in your array does not exist. The most common reasons this will occur is
A. The array itself is null (it has not been initialized )
B. You generate a dynamic index but do not test to make sure it falls within the bounds.

To ensure this does not happen in your code. If you pass an array into a method, then the first thing the method should do, is test that the object is not null. If you are dynamically deriving the index, you should always test that the value of the index is less than the array length.

Read full topic
